This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

bugs.title: CVE-2022-0156 vim: use-after-free while treating allocated lines in user functions

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-0156 vim: use-after-free while treating allocated lines in user functions

long_desc.thetext:
A use-after-free possible.

Reference:

https://huntr.dev/bounties/47dded34-3767-4725-8c7c-9dcb68c70b36

Upstream fix :
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/9f1a39a5d1cd7989ada2d1cb32f97d84360e050f
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/143367256836b0f69881dc0c65ff165ae091dbc5 (additional required fix)

Created vim tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2039845]
Vim versions prior to 8.2 do not seem to be vulnerable to this flaw
The flaw was introduced in v8.2.3902. Older versions are not impacted by this flaw.

comment.text: looks ok for me so far.

bugs.title: CVE-2022-0158 vim: heap-based read buffer overflow in compile_get_env()

bugzilla.short_desc: CVE-2022-0158 vim: heap-based read buffer overflow in compile_get_env()

long_desc.thetext:
Possible Heap-based Buffer Overflow.

Reference:

https://huntr.dev/bounties/ac5d7005-07c6-4a0a-b251-ba9cdbf6738b
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5f25c3855071bd7e26255c68bf458b1b5cf92f39

Created vim tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2039848]

This flaw does not affect vim versions prior to 8.2. 
Since it is a 1 byte out of bound read, it would not be sufficient to crash vim (except if recompiled with an address sanitizer)

comment.text: looks ok for me so far.

long_desc.thetext:

https://huntr.dev/bounties/ac5d7005-07c6-4a0a-b251-ba9cdbf6738b
https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/5f25c3855071bd7e26255c68bf458b1b5cf92f39

Created vim tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2039848]

This flaw does not affect vim versions prior to 8.2. 
Since it is a 1 byte out of bound read, it would not be sufficient to crash vim (except if recompiled with an address sanitizer)

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of fedora-all.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# low, medium, high, urgent (required)
severity=medium

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=2039846,2039848

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for [PUT CVEs HERE]

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

bugs.title: CVE-2021-46059 vim: NULL pointer dereference vulnerability via the vim_regexec_multi function at regexp.c

bugzilla.short_desc: vim: NULL pointer dereference vulnerability via the vim_regexec_multi function at regexp.c

long_desc.thetext:
A Pointer Dereference vulnerability exists in Vim 8.2.3883 via the vim_regexec_multi function at regexp.c, which causes a denial of service.

Reference:

https://huntr.dev/bounties/a9b015e2-59e3-4ed9-8812-d9021e40b8f2/

Created vim tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 2039851]
This CVE has been rejected : https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=2021-46059

As th CVE has been rejected, can you please remove as well the bugzilla alias to the CVE, this will defintively confuse people checking for the CVE finding it though officially rejected but still finding here a reference accordingly. Would that be possible?

comment.text: looks ok for me so far.
